title: Is anyone know what font is this?
author: tammeyim

comments.content:
Is this embroidered lettering? If so, embroidery machines often have their own fonts.

- Mike Yanega
is there any similar font like that?

The ampersand is similar to some Art Deco and Speedball designs. For example Register Sans BTN

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20150414233620im_/http:/typophile.com/files/RegisterSansDandC_5237.jpg)
  
 [http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/btn/register-sans-btn/](http://web.archive.org/web/20150414233620/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/btn/register-sans-btn/ "http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/btn/register-sans-btn/")  
Don

As for the capital letters, you might like Mark Simonson's Goldenbook [http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/marksimonson/goldenbook/](http://web.archive.org/web/20150414233620/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/marksimonson/goldenbook/ "http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/marksimonson/goldenbook/") which has capital letters similar in proportions to your sample and also has similar tiny serifs. It has a late 1920's flavor.  
Don
